result.execSummary:
The defendant Tasha R Monroe was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Cash bail applied - PAID IN FULL.
Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling.

Parenting class and follow through as deemed appropriate by Agent.
No physical discipline/punishment of children.
Comply with all court orders out of the juvenile court.
No use or possession of alcohol, illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia.
No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription.
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of any and all prescriptions.
Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent.
No association with known drug users or dealers and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged and distributed.
No violent contact with the victim or any other family member.
Defendant to contact DOC by 09:00 a.m. on 08-27-2015.

records.addlTxt: Wis. Dept. of Corrections notice of case status change received.  Outstanding financial obligations have been satisfied.
with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Ted S. Szczupakiewicz appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant Tasha R Monroe in court with attorney Jason Daniel Baltz.  

State moves to amend from a Felony to two misdemeanors.
Amended information filed.
Defense has no objections.

Defendant enters a plea of No Contest to the amended charges.
Court finds the defendant Guilty of the amended charges.


Court orders the following:
Count 1:
WITHHELD SENTENCE;
2 Days Credit - If Revoked.

Term of Probation:  16 Months.
Concurrent to count 2.
CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:  
Parenting Class and follow through as deemed appropriate by agent.
No physical discipline/punishment of children.
Comply with all court orders out of the juvenile court.
No Use or Possession of a controlled substances or drug paraphernalia.
No Use or Possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription;
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of all prescriptions
Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling 
No Violant contact with:  the victim or anyother family member.
No association with known drug users or dealers and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged, or distributed.
Defendant to contact DOC by 9:00 a.m. tomorrow (08/27/15).

Costs:  $243
Apply Bail to counts 1 & 2 and refund balance to the posting party.




Count 2:
WITHHELD SENTENCE;

Term of Probation:  16 Months.
Concurrent to count 1.
CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:  
Same as count 1.

Costs:  $243
Apply Bail to counts 1 & 2 and refund balance to the posting party.
